snippet: Sharp exchanges between the U.S. and Russia over Russian military aid to the Syrian government appeared to have dampened a brief spirit of cooperation.
abstract: Russian Foreign Ministry issues response to United States warning about escalating Syrian conflict by providing military aid to Pres Bashar al-Assad's government; ministry says Russian military aid policy in country has been consistent; analysts say Russian military aid may increase as part of effort to paint US as more interested in toppling Assad than combating Islamic State group.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: Sharp exchanges between the U.S. and Russia over Russian military aid to the Syrian government appeared to have dampened a brief spirit of cooperation.

headline.main: Russia Answers U.S. Criticism Over Military Aid to Syria
headline.print_headline: Russia Answers Criticism From U.S. Over Military Aid to Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
